Hello hello! My full name is Facundo Nicolas Guzm√°n Olariaga, for friends I am Nico and Facu for family, for work I am a faithful apprentice and especially in full stack web development, with a strong motivation to create exceptional digital experiences.

I love everything related to technology, but not as much as my ‚ù§Boca‚ù§ jr ‚ù§ FOOTBALL team.

I am ready and willing to face new challenges and learn from each experience. Both my results-oriented approach and my ability to work in a team allow me to face projects with creativity and efficiency.
sub-title-services: The things i can do for you
web-development-list: Designing and building websites and web applications using best practices.
Developing responsive, mobile-friendly websites that work on various devices.
Integrating websites and applications with databases and APIs.
Providing assistance to website users and clients.
freelance-list: Ability to research and learn new technologies.
Maintain clear and constant communication with customers.
in-the-team-list: Use agile methodologies such as Scrum.
Maintain constant communication between team members through meetings.
Maintain an open mind and willing to learn from other team members.
Create and maintain clear and up-to-date documentation on the project.
portfolio-item-description: One of the first websites I made when I joined this world of web development. It is a landing page using Bootstrap and adapting it for both tablet and mobile.

As a practice I made this resume to hand out to potential recruiters. Besides, the good thing about this is that it is interactive, it has links that lead to my contact. Although it is basic, nowadays it could improve it more.
Blog created from a coffee shop where there is information about coffee, there is a 'courses' section and another to send a message through a form.
Frontend clothing store created while studying on Udemy, it has three sections for your research. Simulate a sketch for an online store.
The objective of this project was as an introduction to the development of the Angular framework.
Application using the Rick and Morty Rest API. Allows you to filter by name in the search engine if not by scrolling down. It allows easy access, since I implemented Lazy Loading.
